Comment: Respectively: 'do something fast'; 'something that moves fast'.
Respectively: 'do something fast'; 'something that moves fast'.
Latter refers to later in the day.
Latter refers to later in the day.
A money term, lit. 'thousand.peso.palm racim one'.
The latter is 'like in action/character'. 'Similar, alike in looks' is pa'paa.
The latter is 'like in action/character'. 'Similar, alike in looks' is pa'paa.
Also deep down, as in a cave, e'dua.
A thin person is kʰaite'kʰee; sĩau'taa.
Respectively: people; animals and things. Lit. 'stand-continue.do'.
Respectively: people; animals and things. Lit. 'stand-continue.do'.
Respectively: 'to be outside'; to go outside'.
Respectively: 'to be outside'; to go outside'.
Lit. 'buttocks black' 15.650. 'Generous' is ã'tau pʰo'ree lit. 'buttocks red' 15.660.
Lit. 'silver not.have'. 'Poor and suffering' is čupɨ'ria.
Respectively: carry with trumpline to head; carry a person on back.
Respectively: carry with trumpline to head; carry a person on back.
Lit. 'knees-erg. walk'. For snakes: ur̃ahu- 'bi-pa 'drag by-belly'.
Splash with hand. 'To splatter' is hĩčoo-.
Means to sink to the bottom. Also piru-baai- to sink under the surface.
The latter is to 'turn upside down'.
The latter is to 'turn upside down'.
Refers to 'genipa (jagua)', body paint made from the tree fruit.
Respectively: fan an object; fan a person/ cool with a fan.
Respectively: fan an object; fan a person/ cool with a fan.
E. g. to wash dishes, face, hands. 'To wash clothes' is tʰõ-.
Respectively: 'squeeze to extract juice or milk' 04.410; 'wring', as with a twist.
Respectively: 'squeeze to extract juice or milk' 04.410; 'wring', as with a twist.
Means 'vine', lit. 'tie-plant'. 'Twine' is čɨ; 'tumpline (head strap) is hau'čira 'bark'.
Lit. 'hook-bite'; refers to a plant with hooks on the leaf edge that does not leave a burning sensation.
Actually is a leaf—not root. 'Curare' is pa'kʰuru 'neera, 'tree poison'.
Fruit is 'sera; 'pʰata; ãpor̃o'mia, meaning 'banana; plantain (cooking banana); guineo'.
Respectively: 'chonta palm' (with durable wood); chontaduro (with red/yellow edible fruits). Also u'rutʰa, 'mil peso palm'; tʰũ'kʰĩra 'gicra p.'; 'ar̃a 'pambil/ barigón p.'.
Respectively: 'chonta palm' (with durable wood); chontaduro (with red/yellow edible fruits). Also u'rutʰa, 'mil peso palm'; tʰũ'kʰĩra 'gicra p.'; 'ar̃a 'pambil/ barigón p.'.
To shell corn. To beat it: wɨ-.
Latter is 'seed ball/ round-unit'. Also 'hõre, 'seed plants'.
Latter is 'seed ball/ round-unit'. Also 'hõre, 'seed plants'.
To clean weeds from crop is pu-.
From Span., used in curing ceremony.
'Bedding (covers, mat)' is 'kʰɨda; barkcloth (damajagua) covering is hoi'pʰaru, from Hibiscus lilaceus.
Refers to low fence around edge of house.
Lit. 'house flat'. Flooring material is (te) kʰɨ̃'dapʰo.
Made of cloth, used inside a house.
Lit. 'ear-origin'. Also pa'kʰuru 'kʰera, 'wood perfume', man's earring. Also čiri-'čiri, ornate.
Refers to the hair--not the skin.
Refers to 'masato' or 'chicha'. Also bekʰai'tʰua petau-'dee, 'chicha corn-of'.
Respectively: 'rotten; rotten plant material or wood; rotten food'.
Respectively: 'rotten; rotten plant material or wood; rotten food'.
Respectively: 'rotten; rotten plant material or wood; rotten food'.
Latter is lit. 'banana red-that.was'. Also 'pʰata 'kʰuara, 'plantain yellow'.
Latter is lit. 'banana red-that.was'. Also 'pʰata 'kʰuara, 'plantain yellow'.
Lit. trans.; intrans. Also hõ-, 'eat fruit'.
Lit. trans.; intrans. Also hõ-, 'eat fruit'.
Lit. 'pelvic naked'; it may also indicate naked upper torso. Also kʰa'pʰɨa kʰa'daa, 'torso/body naked (without a shirt)'. Completely naked (male) is me ãkʰa'daa, lit. 'penis naked' 04.492.
Lit. 'hand-ball.(strength) weak'. Also the verb sẽ-.
Lit. 'medicine/poison know'. Also ne-'kʰida kʰa'waa, 'generic-leaf know'.
Respectively: 'a cut; lesion; wound caused by witchcraft or an evil spirit'.
Respectively: 'a cut; lesion; wound caused by witchcraft or an evil spirit'.
Respectively: 'a cut; lesion; wound caused by witchcraft or an evil spirit'.
Lit. 'strength not.be'; see 04.810. Also kʰa'pʰɨa tʰu'maa, lit. 'body weak'.
Refers to humans, lit. 'sickness-many-that.was'. 'piu-da, refers to animals, lit. 'die-that.was'. Verbal forms are hai-ʔidaa-; piu-, human, animal.
Also means 'urine'. 'Bladder' is siwa te, lit. 'urine house/container'.
Actually means 'protuberance'; also used to refer to protruding part of an inanimate item. See 'tongue' 04.260.
Lit. 'generic-wing'. Also means 'fin' 03.652. Also ne-'ʔi, 'generic edge'.
Lit. 'generic-wing'. Also means 'fin' 03.652. Also ne-'ʔi, 'generic edge'.
Also means 'leg'. Also 'bɨɨrɨ, which also means 'bone'. Note symmetry with 'arm, hand' 04.310, 04.330.
Lit. '(leg) fat/full'. Also ('hĩru) pʰɨ'rɨma, '(leg) calf'. 'Shin' is 'bɨɨrɨ 'tau, 'leg/bone ball'; cf. 'eye' 04.210.
Respectively used for: human or animal; human, animal, thing. The latter also means 'bone' 04.160.
Respectively used for: human or animal; human, animal, thing. The latter also means 'bone' 04.160.
Also means 'hand'; cf. 'finger' 04.340. Note symmetry with 'leg, foot' 04.370, 04.350.
Lives in small pools. A poisonous tree f. is kʰõ'kʰõi; a white tree f. is 'maupa. Also 'toad (common)' is 'baso; a giant toad (lives in the ground), me'bore. 'Tadpole' is buku'lu ko.
Lit. 'worm land-origin'. A caterpiller worm is kʰi.
Refers to a blue fly. A 'deer fly (tábano)' is 'sĩta.
Refers to a tar-like product from small wild bee colonies.
Lit. 'generic-tiny/ claw'. Also 'leaf-cutter a.' 'tʰãa; 'army a.' ['huan san'gulo], from Span.; 'tucandera a.' hẽ'saa. An 'ant-hill' is ne-'pʰisi te, lit. 'ant house'.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'His/hers' is iru-'de 'him/her (unmarked)-of'; iči-'de 'him/her (marked)-of'.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'His/hers' is iru-'de 'him/her (unmarked)-of'; iči-'de 'him/her (marked)-of'.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'Yours (sg.)' is pë're, with underlying form: pɨ-'de.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'Yours (sg.)' is pë're, with underlying form: pɨ-'de.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'Mine' is më're, underlying form: mɨ-'de, 'I/me-of'.
Respectively: unmarked; marked. 'Mine' is më're, underlying form: mɨ-'de, 'I/me-of'.
Lit. 'unite-sleep' 04.610. To mate informally is araa-pa-, 'come together'.
Also mean 'small'. Also 'war̃a 'čai; 'war̃a 'čakʰe, 'child small'. Male baby is ɨmɨ'kʰĩra 'čai/ 'čakʰe. Female baby is 'kʰau 'čai/ 'čakʰe; 'wẽra 'čai. Vocative form is 'yãyã.
Also mean 'small'. Also 'war̃a 'čai; 'war̃a 'čakʰe, 'child small'. Male baby is ɨmɨ'kʰĩra 'čai/ 'čakʰe. Female baby is 'kʰau 'čai/ 'čakʰe; 'wẽra 'čai. Vocative form is 'yãyã.
From Span. 'fósforo'. 'Flint' is sɨgɨ-'mau 'flint-rock'. A flint-rock fire kit is sɨgɨ-'batʰa, 'flint-throw'.
Also means 'shine'. A 'burning sensation' is ura-tɨ-.
Plural form. All segments are realized as their nasalized counterparts.
Lit. 'river turn.around'. Also to 'kʰida čaa'ree, 'rapids ('river teeth hard')'. The 'fork of the river' is to 'nera 'river fork'.
Respectively: 'river, stream (river small)'. Also to kʰɨ̃, 'headwaters ('river point') 12.352; to 'tʰai, 'mouth of river (river entrance/mouth)' 04.240.
Respectively: 'river, stream (river small)'. Also to kʰɨ̃, 'headwaters ('river point') 12.352; to 'tʰai, 'mouth of river (river entrance/mouth)' 04.240.
Lit. 'enter-that.was river', refers to an oxbow lake or a slough.
Respectively: 'edge; river edge' 01.360. 'Ocean shore' is 'pʰusa i.
Respectively: 'edge; river edge' 01.360. 'Ocean shore' is 'pʰusa i.
Lit. 'cut.off-that.was', means island in a river.
A 'steep incline' is 'ee 'tau tʰõ'dee, 'hill round-unit steep'.
A 24 hour day is 'kʰãima. 'Daytime' is ãs'taawa.
A 24 hour day is 'kʰãima. 'Daytime' is ãs'taawa.
Also tauhaa'weda. Also ɨ̃da-tɨ-po'dopa, 'shine.bright-inter.change-upon'; and kʰaraa-tɨ-po'dopa, 'glow-upon'.
Latter means 'suffer-smell'. 'Bad body odor' is ɨ̃'sia.
Latter means 'suffer-smell'. 'Bad body odor' is ɨ̃'sia.
First form also means 'face' 04.204: surface color; interior color.
First form also means 'face' 04.204: surface color; interior color.
Lit. 'very red'. Also pʰoree kʰĩra pʰaimaa, 'dark red'. lit. 'red face black'.
Respectively: lit. 'tooth dull', as a knife; dull point.
Respectively: lit. 'tooth dull', as a knife; dull point.
Latter is 'cool-inter.change'. To be cold (person) is hi'sua.
Latter is 'cool-inter.change'. To be cold (person) is hi'sua.
Respectively: refers to material; skin. Also haha'haa.
Respectively: refers to material; skin. Also haha'haa.
Means 'want'. Also čikʰi'nia iru ba-, means 'love one another'.
Lit. 'good-not'. Also 'tʰãri 'pʰua 'liver hurt'; and kʰĩ'sia pa'raa 'thoughts to.have'.
Lit. 'thoughts hurt'; and kʰĩ'sia pa'raa 'thoughts to.have'.
Lit. 'face fear'. All sements in both words (other than the kʰ), are realized as their nasalized counterparts.
Respectively: includes body sensations; respectful fear. Also ãčobee-ʔi'daa 'fear-many' (f. of what will happen).
Respectively: includes body sensations; respectful fear. Also ãčobee-ʔi'daa 'fear-many' (f. of what will happen).
Respectively: pres. (after aux.vb, e.g. ba-); other than pres.; causative suffix.
Respectively: pres. (after aux.vb, e.g. ba-); other than pres.; causative suffix.
Respectively: pres. (after aux.vb, e.g. ba-); other than pres.; causative suffix.
Lit. 'be-that.was-if'. Also -'pɨrã; -ra used with past; used with pres. or future.

Used in answer to yes/no question. Also negatives: (pedee)-'kʰaa '(talk)-hab.neg.'; (pedee)-'naa(-hi) '(talk)-imperative.neg (-imperative)'; (pedee)-ʔ'e '(talk)-neg.'; (pedee)-ʔ'ee '(talk)-without'; (či 'wẽra) 'wẽe '(his wife) without'. Also 'not have/ not be (Span. 'no hay')' wẽʔ'ẽ.
Respectively: as in 'What (was it)?'; 'What (is your name)?'. Also sãga-'hi-ma 'What happened? (past information)'.
Respectively: as in 'What (was it)?'; 'What (is your name)?'. Also sãga-'hi-ma 'What happened? (past information)'.
Respectively: to be where; to go where.
Respectively: to be where; to go where.
Lit. 'our head'. Also 'tači wai'bɨa, 'our great'. The spiritual shaman leader (female) is 'tači 'nawe 'our mother'; (male) 'tači a'kʰõre 'our father'.
Refers to 'bastón de brujería', used in a shaman's ceremonies.
Lit. 'our father' 02.350, highly respected shaman or spiritual leader.
Lit. 'our mother' 02.360, highly respected shaman or spiritual leader.
Refers to master (owner) of an animal; also means 'father-in-law' 02.610.
Lit. 'work-hab.', i.e. 'worker'. Also tau'pʰãida, a stepchild who often works for his/her keep.
Respectively: vocative form (male to male); from Span. 'compañero'.
Respectively: vocative form (male to male); from Span. 'compañero'.
Latter, lit. 'river-spear', refers to instrument used for fish.

Respectively: shoot a gun; shoot an arrow or dart.
